title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description:
When performing the following steps, the 'Revert' operation in the java editor takes significantly longer than closing and reopening the file:

1. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog
2. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it

After performing steps 1 and 2, if I select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
OB: When I repeat steps 1 and 2, and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes around 15 seconds for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original.
EB: When I repeat steps 1 and 2, selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor should replace the contents of the window with the original in a reasonable amount of time, similar to the experience when closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the java editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. when prompted to save changes, select 'No'.
4. Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
5. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
Expected: The contents of the window should be replaced with the original in a reasonable amount of time.
Actual: The operation takes approximately 15 seconds to complete.
